jcr:content.jcr:description: Bezons, Santiago, 19 July 2017 - Worldline [Euronext:WLN], European leader in the payments and transactional services industry, today announces it has been awarded “Best Chile 2017”. Worldline Chile was nominated among 10 companies in the small companies’ category and was rewarded for the first place.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Worldline Chile awarded “Best Chile 2017” for its commitment with the well-being of its collaborators

richtext.text:
Bezons, Santiago, 19 July 2017 - Worldline [Euronext:WLN], European leader in the payments and transactional services industry, today announces it has been awarded “Best Chile 2017”. Worldline Chile was nominated among 10 companies in the small companies’ category and was rewarded for the first place. 

Worldline Chile won the “Best Chile 2017” award in the small companies’ category (less than 150 employees), an initiative that recognizes companies’ commitment to issues such as well-being, healthy living and financial future of its collaborators. The “Best Chile 2017” award is part an employee program jointly developed by “Principal”, “PeopleFirst” and “Diario La Tercera”.

The Wellbeing@Worldline program has implemented practices that span the workers labor future, allowing new levels of collaboration and flexibility in the offices present in the country. This supported by its long term Corporate Social Responsibility ambition “TRUST 2020” that aims to increase the collaborator’s satisfaction.

It should be highlighted that Worldline Chile has a solid program in terms of insurance, benefits, health, wellness and organizational culture.

 

“This award recognizes Worldline's commitment in the well-being and the development of its employees around the world. In Chile, for example, our program called Wellbeing@Worldline, which was launched a few years ago, has improved the working environment of Worldline employees and the social impact of the company on their well-being. Worldline always strives to go further in this field in order to affirm its role as a socially responsible company.  says Patrice Gry, Human Resources Director of Worldline.

 

About Worldline

Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. Worldline delivers new-generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with nearly 45 years of experience, Worldline supports and contributes to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services, Mobility & e-Transactional Services and Financial Services including equensWorldline. Worldline employs more than 8,700 people worldwide, with estimated pro forma revenue of more than € 1.5 billion on a yearly basis. Worldline is an Atos company. worldline.com
